snippet.title: Sunderland dents Chelsea's title hopes
snippet.description: In another twist to this unpredictable English Premier League season, last-place Sunderland damaged Chelsea's title hopes with a 2-1 upset at Stamford Bridge on Saturday.

snippet.title: D.C. United at Columbus Crew
snippet.description: D.C. United boasts a three-game unbeaten streak but hasn't won in central Ohio since 2007.

snippet.title: Quigg stops Munyai to keep WBA super-bantam title
snippet.description: Scott Quigg of Britain retained his WBA super-bantamweight title by stopping substitute Tshifhiwa Munyai of South Africa in the second round on Saturday.

snippet.title: US goalie Howard commits to Everton 2 more years
snippet.description: American goalkeeper Tim Howard has signed a two-year contract extension to stay with Everton until 2018.

snippet.title: READ IN: Friday, April 18, 2014
snippet.description: ObamaCare hits 8 million, Transpo bill funding discussions begin, the Mitt Romney book club, LCV drops $1 mil in Colorado

snippet.title: Altidore's playing time a concern for Klinsmann
snippet.description: Jozy Altidore's disappointing first season with England's Sunderland has less than a month remaining, and it appears as though the American's struggles for playing time aren't finished.

snippet.title: 100,000 sellout for Real Madrid-Manchester United
snippet.description: It took less than a day for all tickets to sell out at the 100,000-plus seat Michigan Stadium for the Aug. 2 exhibition game between world soccer powerhouses Manchester United and Real Madrid.

snippet.title: New releases from Insider bookshop
snippet.description: New reading material ahead of the World Cup ...

snippet.title: Real Madrid wins 19th Copa del Rey title
snippet.description: Gareth Bale raced down the field, avoided a defender and rolled the ball under goalkeeper Jose Pinto in the 90th minute, giving Real Madrid a 2-1 win over Barcelona on Wednesday night and its 19th Copa del Rey title.
